reviews_data.review_text:
Horrible place....

Avoid !

Bigotted manager, childlike emotions, and more than likely racist.

Owner hired a manager that struggles to bend down,  has several tattoos,  and piercings.  That is okay, but this woman is clearly struggling to be noticed, and insecure.

An insecure manager is not fun to deal with.   She starts off extremely rude in greeting (defensive for no reason).  Then I tell her my order is a little unique, I want one espresso, but in a big glass (lots of water). First I get a face from her, then a tone, then she argues and argues she can't do it.

Every word out her mouth is with "your an a-hole" tone  (and for what, such a simple order ordered a million places).

Then  I  repeat with a smile the order, and she says she will charge me full large cup regardless of shots.  I tell her no other shops charges for 4 expresso shots when you order one (I get more attitude).

A Karen customer jumps in and says go to Starbucks (and the manager repeats this). She says,  "if you care about prices there's a Starbucks down the street",  with more attitude.

Then says she won't make the order.

Place run by children.... and only an entitled person would do that on owner's watch because they believe owner is an incompetent idiot not minding the store  (and they're un-fire-able).

What does owner think happens when a young woman who is desperate to have the world stare at her (mixes with having to know some social etiquette) ??

Early morning, no customer, I came in calm...but she was ready to give attitude from the moment I stepped in.

I could post this message a few places where this potentially bigoted establishment might get some heat....

but instead I would suggest AVOID or support community vitriol.

Good vibes and the coffee was very tasty, but our to-go burritos took 45 minutes. Between the 10 minutes in line and the 45 minutes (and counting) to get our food this quick stop turned into an ordeal.

Only go if you have time one your hands.
Had an Iced latte with brown sugar and vanilla and loved it every bit. It has great coffee and you'll find many techies working.

Great coffee shop! Just keep in mind free parking is limited, paid parking is around the building, and limited seating inside. Get there early or be open to share the community table in the middle. You may meet new people. Ordering food will take time since it's a small kitchen, so if you are in a rush, get that coffee and a small bite for the road. You can visit another day to try the breakfast burrito.
Love the vanilla lattes both hot & iced! And I love their quiche! So yummy :)

My husband and I stopped in for coffee while exploring the area. I always order a black cold brew in all coffee shops. The one here is bitter and I could only finish half of it before I tossed it. My husband liked his latte.

Was my go-to coffee shop while living in Charlotte! Always fantastic coffee and breakfast, as well as friendly staff. My only gripe is that the building, while cute, frequently was incredibly crowded (especially on weekends). There's great outdoor seating as well and it's in a nice neighborhood to walk/bike around.

The iced matcha and avocado toast are some
of the best in town!
Chill vibes when you wanna get work done.
I had the "plough boy grit bowl" which was GREAT! Limited seating when crowded and raining.
Love the coffee here, and the staff are always very congenial

I have been to this coffee shop maybe 4 times so far and it's honestly the best. The environment is lovely with all the plants and seating. The staff is always warm and welcoming. And the pastries I've had are delightful. They seem to make their own syrups and I get a nice iced latte everytime. The best coffee place in plaza Midwood for sure, I've tried most of them by now and it is #1.

Our top coffee shops in CLT. We come here every week(we live close by)  and absolutely love the atmosphere. Their lattes are amazing, you can't go wrong with any of their drinks really. Their seasonal drinks are creative and fun to try. Baristas are awesome !!! Come hang in Plaza and get yaself a koffiii.

[March, 22th, 2024]
I have been visiting this place for nearly 3 years. I have never once been disappointed with coffee. And there are seasonal coffee menu. I highly recommend WHITE CHOCOLATE PISTACHIO ORANGE LATTE (with oatmilk). It was so good!!   
_ _ _ _
The coffee (Ice Vanila Latte woth oat milk) was good, and I highly recommend Grit Bowl(+egg)! It was really delicious :) Also the staff was very helpful and kind.
My favorite coffee shop in town!

One of my girlfriends and I wanted to try a cute coffee place, as we are both coffee fans and visiting the Charlotte area.  This place was super disappointing, low quality, and incredibly overpriced. Our breakfast sandwiches were tiny, cold, and made with a hamburger bun. My friend's gluten free option came un-toasted and we had to ask them to warm it up. The cappuccino was good. Check out the pictures attached for a better understanding of the mediocre quality of the eats!
Coffee was super, the artistry was impressive, the service was fabulous, and the workers were very friendly!
Avocado toast is great!
The best coffee spot in CLT
The matcha at Undercurrent Coffee is flawless! It is not too sweet, delicious and always consistent. The atmosphere is clean and welcoming and a favorite spot!

They have the worst customer service. Every time I've come I've had to wait for over 20 min for a basic cappuccino. Also ordered a breakfast sandwich which I waited for 15 min(fine), but then they forgot the bacon and I had to wait another 15 min on top of that just to get some on the side! NOT WORTH IT.
Great bagels sandwiches, good coffee

I've actually been here dozens of times and I realize the reason I've never left the review. The coffee is so good that in the moment that's all I want to focus on. The golden milk is delicious and the baristas are really technical and it makes for a great poor. I would highly recommend, also their food selections are great!
The avocado toast was little too salty but the coffee... oh my god the coffee is soooo good.

So today was my second time going to undercurrent coffee, the first time I went everything was fine. But today when I went to open my food, I noticed a large hair inside if my sandwich and it looks like a second one in the top right hand corner. I don't see how they could overlook this, I noticed it immediately when I opened the box... thankfully I didn't take a bite! I believe when handling people's food, you should be extra careful to make sure things like this don't happen. When I brought it to the manager's attention they did refund my money back without issue, even for the latte that I kept. I appreciate the way handled the situation but unfortunately I will not be back!

Ordered an iced latte, paid $5.50 and was not served a latte :( I watched the barista pour the coffee out of a pitcher and shake it up with milk. She made a shot of espresso on the side that I assumed she may add but she overfilled my cup and never added any espresso. I have never been served an espresso-less latte especially for over $5. There's a reason that the latte is more expensive I was disappointed when the barista called my name for the drink I was hoping wasn't going to be my coffee. Other than this the ambiance was nice and everyone was kind but it's not fair to charge a customer for an item and assume they won't know the difference. At least the coffee was alright.

I ordered an iced coffee with oatmilk and it tasted horrible. The taste was very bitter & old, I will not be coming again. It took 15 minutes to get my order and others who were after me received their drinks prior. I paid $5 plus tax for a small and I was not happy with the taste of my drink at all. Will not recommend to others

They took away my buns! My tiny mighty breakfast sandwich used to be delicious until they changed the breading to English muffins. Coffee is delicious, baristas are very kind. However, I will NOT be back until my buns are returned!
Excellent coffee. Plenty of seating.
Good coffee in real porcelain cups. Really nice atmosphere and friendly baristas. The only thing I'd change is I prefer my coffee hotter
It's awesome.I ordered caramel latte. Coffee is really great and they have perfect skills. I had a great time here!! I absolutely recommend it here
Love the coffee!

Their iced vanilla latte was amazing! Their syrups are also made in-house. Also try the Autumn Sweater if you're in the mood for a seasonal drink. The drinks are also not too sweet which was refreshing because most places are way too sweet in my opinion. Price is standard for a coffee shop. Paid $13.80 for two lattes.
We were a little noisy in our meeting, but I do absolutely love this place.  Sorry to all who wanted a quiet atmosphere...
Their coffee is amazing! Pour over never lets me down
Love that there's outdoor seating! Many nutritious food options. I love that they serve REAL food, not stuff packaged in plastic. Be careful with parking. Depending where one parks, there's a fee.
The cold brew here is great, and the shop has a great atmosphere.
Awesome caramel latte, tasty, quick, and everyone was really polite even though their payment system was crashing
Their ice latte is unbelievably good, like seriously.
Best Pour over in Charlotte. Vibes are high as well.
Coffee was great and pretty clean modern coffee shop.

Walked in the door fri morning. Three employees. Stood and waited 5 minutes to place my order (nobody in line but they were making drinks) placed my order for a decaf pour over which they did not have so they did an Americano. With tip paid about five bucks (4$+1$) - for a shot of coffee. Honestly the most mediocre if not subpar experience I've had, but I don't know what I expected. These are the same people that were: face shields, masks, and had plastic up all at the same time while screaming for customers to do the same (Yes I literally had a lady scream at me once because I walked in the door trying to put on a mask and didn't have it all the way on - which wasn't her right to do in the first place no matter what any newscast told you). I decided to try them again after 2 years and The same experience + .005% (at least nobody yelled at me this time). Last visit ever. I'm sure they'll survive just based on the amount of disposable income in midwood but they really shouldn't. Incidentally the same person owns night swim, so I'm not even going to bother trying that place.
Staff here were all so kind. It was pouring rain outside but the atmosphere inside was warm and sunny. Delicious coffee.
Incredible coffee
Sick little local shop. Great vibes and awesome coffee.

I came here to dine in and have coffee and was then told that I could only order to go even though I came in a little before 2 pm and their hours said they close at 4pm. Meanwhile every other patron was able to order dine in except only me. There was then two employees laughing about it once I questioned as to why I wasn't able to order to go like every other patron. This in turn ruined my experience nor was I told that my order could only be to go until AFTER I had already placed and paid for my order. Very disappointed. Not sure what the issue was and as to why I was being singled out.
Beautiful lattes, great place to work, awesome neighborhood, friendly staff.
Not a fan of their iced chai. Even if you ask for it with no sweetener , it's still super sweet. Not sure if their almond milk or their chai concentrate is pre- sweetened but holy cow...
We love Under Current coffee but they are just hopelessly slow and not very efficient. They have missed our order at least 3 times over 6-12 months!
Good coffee, nice place in the heart of Plaza Midwood.

I seriously just love this place so much. I don't live in Charlotte, but I have family here, and every time my husband and I visit, Undercurrent is a must-go. The brown sugar latte is supreme, and all the food we've tried has been delicious. Plus, the space just has good vibes. 10/10!
Very nice place and delicious cappuccino.
Coffee was just ok, food was slightly overpriced, cozy inside but a bit cold

Coffee and food was absolutely delicious! I got an iced sea salt mocha. I also tried some coffee cake, a parfait, and a sausage breakfast sandwich. All of it was fantastic!

Service was OK. They didn't repeat our order and we couldn't see a screen with the order on it so it wasn't until after we got all our other food that we realized they didn't hear us order the overnight oats.

The outdoor seating was lovely! The cushioned chairs indoors were kinda dirty. Crumbs and stuff on them that the employees just didn't have time to clean between people.
Over priced .
My first morning in Charlotte after a 12+ hour travel day, I was blown away by my iced Americano with cinnamon roll syrup. Just wow. Very great coffee and a simple but marvelous interior aesthetic.

Took almost 40 mins to have 4 drinks made, and they were horrible,
And expensive.
We loved this little coffee shop. The coffee was fantastic and the atmosphere was superb.
first and last time visiting. not friendly , didn't even make eye contact. waited 25 mins on a coffee that ended up spilling in my car 2 mins later because the lid wasn't on all the way. Waste of $7

Took my girlfriend here on a Sunday afternoon for a coffee and we loved everything about it.
Great coffee with an atmosphere to match.
This will definitely be our go to for coffee.
This place was recommended by a friend and it did not dissapoint. The Latte and the peanut butter banana bread was amazing. Great boost before for my walk to NoDa.

this is my least favorite coffee shop local to plaza. that being said it wasn't terrible. it's more of a place to go if you don't really care about the quality of your coffee, you just want to sit down and hang out in a pretty spot and have a drink. you'll be waiting for over 20 minutes for anything you get though so make sure you have plenty of time. it really wasn't terrible, there are just so many other better options within walking distance so i gave three stars to reflect the quality compared to the others i prefer.

Coffee is really good, but could benefit from being served a bit hotter. Between receiving it at the front desk and getting to your chair it gets a bit lukewarm for my taste. Still, my experience was mostly positive.

Are you tired of the hustle and bustle in Starbucks? Give this coffee shop a try!! Under Current is a really nice spot, the staff is phenomenal, the vibe and decor is awesome and the prices are reasonable and best of all everything is made from scratch!! Don't miss out on this Charlotte gem and don't forget A Lil Bertie Told You!

I had the pleasure of stumbling upon this coffee shop in charlotte. I was very happy because I was totally pleased with the professionalism and service attitude of the staff. Most importantly the coffee is the best I have ever had in North Carolina and several other places around this country. If you are in that area, this should be the place you go to. You will not regret it.
The best little coffee shop in Plaza to bring your pup, sit outside and work or hangout with friends!
You can taste the juice of coffee fruit in their espresso.
Brown sugar latte bangs. So good hot or iced.  Need to try food next time!

Magical! The staff are super friendly and make a great specialty latte. The white chocolate peppermint latte I got was garnished with a mini candy cane and definitely brightened up my day. New favorite coffee shop in Charlotte!
Great coffee and espresso--they never miss. The space is cool and the baristas are friendly and knowledgeable. Top contender for best coffee in Charlotte.

Golden milk a little bit too sweet Gan Jue Gua He Lai Yi Ma He  You ginger

Soda maple flavor is weird
Affogato here is nice
This is one of the best coffee shops in town! All drinks are amazing! The atmosphere inside is very warm, wonderful staff. Highly recommend visiting!

I go here to do work and order a latte- they have great flavors but too expensive, maybe it's the area and crowd they cater to.
Sometimes it's too crowded and noisy
Other times it's good to do work
Hit and miss
I must say their lattes taste DELICIOUS and are unique in their flavors

Had a normal matcha latte, the maple mattcha latte, a cookie & the black forest latte. Everything was really good even the coffee which I rarely have! The cookie warmed up had lil pools of chocolate~ parking is tricky, cafe is clean, very nice customer service
Some of the best coffee in Charlotte! Always keep an eye out for the seasonal drinks as they tend to be hidden gems.
You can bring your own travel mug and they'll pour the drink in it.
Coffee are fine, nothing too good. It would be great if there was a menu for some nibs..seating is a challenge with limited space offering and arrangement.
Awesome coffee, nice people, cool vibe.
Great coffe here. Their housemade orange soda is delicious, refreshing and not too sweet.

The atmosphere is amazing! Very comfy and cozy. Great coffee and a place to chat. Definitely bring your headphones if you want to work or read because it is a little tight. The food and service was amazing! The breakfast sandwich was very high quality. My only problem was the price. Me and my wife both got breakfast sandwiches and coffees and it was 33 dollars. Again, the quality was exceptional but just got a bit pricey.
5 stars for the coffee and 1 star for the service. Five people inside, no drip coffee, and literally, I was waiting 20 minutes for Americano!
Cafe, frio muy bueno

Waiting time for 2 avocado toasts - 25-30 minutes.
I can't understand this.
If you can't serve food in time - don't offer it for sale.
The matcha latte is delicious, so creamy and not too sweet. Great atmosphere both inside and tables outside too! Fun seasonal drinks
Best coffee in town

Absolutely in love with the Brown Sugar Vanilla latte and the avo toast! I don't know what it is about the recipes of both of those but it just works so perfectly! Not exactly together because of the hot sauce on the toast but in general!
Very cute place. Love the lavender soda.
Best avocado toast in Charlotte!!! They also have gluten free bread. Incredible matcha, and the staff is always great. Love this place!!!!!
First and only coffee shop we tried in Charlotte. So good we went back the next day!
The sea salt mocha latte is phenomenal. Plenty of comfortable seats as well.

Pristine coffee shop with lots of seating at tables or couches and high quality drinks and food (and priced as such ). Quiet, relaxing, great for working remotely: Almost all patrons were on their laptops the day i went.
The shop is very nice inside and out! The ice coffee was really bad and for somewhere around $5 you're better off going anywhere else.

Very inclusive, and the space is actually very nice and open. It's perfect if you want to do work at a coffee shop. The coffee is terrible it's that flavor of burnt beans that results in a BBQ flavor drink bad enough to make you gag.
Great quality world derived coffees and blends in a cozy atmosphere with knowledgeable friendly staff.

I love their seasonal menu! They always have creative options to choose from. Has a great atmosphere and lots of seating close to outlets which is helpful for people like me who work from coffee shops!
Ordered Cafe Latte. Great soothing coffee.

I have been too many times as my "last chance" round. Undercurrent fails in consistency and order time. Each time I've gone the drink tastes different and frankly not good for $7 plus. But, its not just that.. it's the experience. Today, I waited for a regular latte for 20 min. I understand if it is busy but I did not wait in line to order and there appeared to be a few online orders. While waiting for 20 min I watched the four baristas chat, sample multiple drinks, and have no urgency. This drink was ordered to-go at 7:40 am... when people have to get to work. #CentralCoffeeCo
Solid espresso and a small but quality selection of breakfast items. The yogurt granola bowl was one of the best I've had. They're is also convenient parking in the back. Definitely recommended.
Super patient and helpful cashier. Coffee was delicious!

Definitely was not an enjoyable experience. Staff was snooty/spoiled and took forever. There are reliable consistent attitude free choices. That aren't ridiculously over priced. If you're in this place then you are desperate for validation. Not worth it.
Friendly staff!! Delicious coffee and great vibe. Super chill place

I waited 25 minutes for an 8$ less than mediocre cup of melted iced coffee i tossed out from being undrinkable from a staff that seemed reluctantly resigned to serve me for a reason I am not sure of. In a congested overbuilt area with inadequate parking that experienced unrealistic expansion due to hipster runoff demand where the best here is the worst in most actually good neighborhoods. The wool is being pulled. Look at my reviews. I only leave great ones. This is the unicorn. I won't go back. My friends that met me won't go back. When relaying this to other plaza patrons I got the "duh" that place sucks speech and they don't go back.  Anyway. Thanks for a bad morning and enjoy that $8....

Espectacular lugar para ir con los seres que mas te importan, muy buena seleccion de cafes y sus preparaciones, una excelente seleccion de tres, y muy buenas opciones de desayuno saludables para empezar como se debe el dia, tambien si lo que te provoca es algo dulce, tambien. Lo tienen, asi que conseguiras lo que te apetezca! Si esras por esta zona en Charlotte NC no tienes una mejor opcion para pasar un rato de paz y relax con kas personas que amas!!
Very kind baristas, great coffee respectfully prepared. The grit bowl was super tasty and the space was nice. I would definitely come back.
I don't mind paying a little more for my lattes since I know the extra change is going towards the amazing employees here!!! Such nice genuine people.

Nice coffee, courteous service, nice atmosphere. First, the coffee quality is good and the baristas make it better. I tried the cold brew,  a coffee never exposed to heat but   time,  to extract the coffee's oils, sugars, and caffeine. It was good and refreshing, perfect for these hot days. The place is excellent, a pleasant atmosphere to work, think or just relax with the company of friends or just a tasty cup of coffee. The baristas tried to explain what you were going to drink. Overall, a good experience. I want to try more coffees.
Did a coffee tour of Charlotte this weekend, and they had the best latte out of all 10 shops i visited. I'll definitely go back.
Nice neighborhood coffee shop. Service was way better than the other nearby option. Will def. be back.
This is my go to spot for the best coffee around! Love this place so much .
My favorite little coffee shop. It's always a chill vibe in there. They're never out of oat milk and have some of the best Avocado toast I've ever had. Oh and the new cinnamon roll latte is delicious
Very cool place to hang out and have a good coffee!

First time going here and I thought this was one of the best coffee's I've had in the Charlotte area. Super smooth and delicious latte. Very cute interior with some high tops, couches, and standard tables. Electrical outlets available. In house restrooms. Cute outdoor deck with seating. Friendly staff. They also offer food items. Little parking lot next to the shop.

Grabbed there's drinks and breakfast to go this morning from Undercurrent. All three drinks were exceptional! (Hot latte, iced latte, cold brew) They use Onyx and Nightswim coffee, both of which are great! The breakfast food was good, but it was very expensive. Would come here for coffee again but wouldn't purchase food again. The vibe here was a place you would come and stay for a while as well! Overall, great coffee shop!
It was alright. Expensive, and coffee was very dark roast which tasted too strong
Drinks were good, selection was limited. Barista was very nice. Kind of Pricey $$
Lovely coffee shop in the Plaza area. Chill vibe for working or meeting a friend. Friendly bar service and tasty coffee.
Their latte was delicious! I find most cafes don't make a good hot latte but this spot nailed it! It's a cute, cozy spot to sit in too - usually pretty crowded tho
Staff was nice.

Very good coffee, atmosphere and employees. I love stopping in here after my morning run to grab a cup of coffee. Plus they have a water station to get a cup of water without bugging the workers. Favorite drink is a Latte with Oat Milk and Brown Sugar Vanilla.
Nice environment and staff. Coffee has an interesting taste and we weren't fans. Good quiche!
Dope coffee shop in coolest part of Charlotte
Expertise in coffee. Top 3 best coffee shop in Charlotte, but if you're looking for quiet and chill this place is usually packed and with little seating.

Popped in for our after dinner coffees while in the Plaza Midwood area.
What a neat place. My husband and son have been here. This was my first time. Really friendly barista's. I suggest having dinner at Supperland or Calle Sol & then walking it off by heading to Undercurrent Coffee. Kick back & spend some time in this very inspiring coffee shop. Lots of laptops were open. People busy doing their thing. Maybe you'll be the next great playwright. Stop by and enjoy the cool vibes of this place.

One of my fav charlotte coffee shops! Great atmosphere with plenty of open seating (outdoor options weather dependent). Their americano is fabulous, which means they have great espresso. The baristas are always kind which makes the experience even better. Love the location too. Plenty of nearby shops and streets to wander.
very good, but giddy goat is better
Extremely overpriced and underwhelming

Visited on Monday during a quick trip to Charlotte. Great coffee, friendly staff, and ample amounts of comfy seating! Love the vibe of this place and the brown sugar vanilla latte was delicious. Definitely will be visiting again when I'm in the CLT area
Exceptional pour over, great single origin options

Dope spot. Much larger, for seats and space, than I thought.

It's about as good as it can get. Good scene. Vegan friendly snacks too, if that matters to you (it does me, so).

Cheers
Quick, friendly service. I ordered an Americano and I ordered the sweet potato latte for my wife. Both were very good.
Great service! Great location! Great Lattes!! Had the BLT and Tomato soup the last visit and it was delicious!
I'm honestly not a big coffee person but they have excellent seasonal drinks and sodas!

They use ONYX coffee which is a great choice and their seasonal options are on point. Staff is friendly and super helpful. My wife and I walk over to their Plaza Midwood location every Sunday for brunch. Late Sunday mornings are busy though (I think it's the church crowd).
Absolutely wonderful service. This coffee spot is one of the first stores open in the morning. Which is perfect for an impromptu meeting.
Best coffeeshop in Charlotte! They take pride in their drinks and the atmosphere is incredible. Their seasonal Matcha Lattes are amazing
Nice coffee shop. Comfortable seating and they serve onyx coffee!
I thought it was "OK". I wouldn't come out of my way to go here. Tried a cappuccino and it was just sort of bland. Not a fan of their espresso. I've had worse though.
They don't honor cash, forget it
Be patient if they are busy but the coffee is great.  Super friendly staff and some great baked goods too.

The coffee tasted amazing like usual!
The staffs are adorable and the place is gorgeous.
Highly recommend
Great environment, food, and coffee

I spent a few weeks living in Charlotte, within walking distance of Undercurrent Coffee.  Most days I'd walk or ride my bicycle to the cafe and enjoy a hot black coffee.  Either out front at one of the tables with my bicycle, or I'd lock up at the rack and sit at the bar overlooking the barista area.

I typically like to sit where I can watch the baristas working.  When I catch myself admiring their productivity it snaps me back to my own toil.  Either job applications, coursework, or if I'm lucky, just a book I'm reading.

It was during my second week sitting in this seat when one of the baristas acknowledged me for the first time.

"Do you think we're funny?"  she asked, assuming that I had been listening in on their conversation.

"I do." I hadn't been listening that time, but I've listened before and watched them enough to know that they were.

I've often worked in service jobs or been a patron in service environments where the staff do not particularly enjoy being around each other.  Most times it's hardly perceptible, but you can always tell when a group of employees are friends.  And it's a wonderful thing to be a part of.

And that's what I go to Undercurrent coffee for.  The baristas will learn your name, and use it.  They'll remember your order and know what to recommend if you'd like to try something new.  But above all, they'll be really kind.
A great little coffee hangout.
Excellent place to stop. My daughter is fascinated by latte art and this place did not disappoint.
Wonderful staff, excellent and high quality coffee. I usually get the cold brew and find a place to get some work done. Outstanding ambiance! Food is on the pricey side for me but it's also solid

Superb coffee and breakfast sandwiches (add bacon and avocado). They have a great hot sauce too. Line may be long but it moves fast and is worth the short wait. Staff are really nice. Seating areas are comfortable. The restroom is large and has great natural light.
Decent coffee with a neat and clean environment. Helpful stuff.

The coffee is great! Lattes are very smooth and have great flavor! The summer specials are very good the lavender latte is amazing as well as the lavender matcha latte. The service was great and coffee was ready quickly. Atmosphere was very calm and there were plenty of people were studying. I would recommend to a friend.

Came by on a Saturday morning, super busy but they were moving through the line really well. I got an iced latte in one of their glass cups and was really disappointed in the espresso to milk ratio. I could barely taste the espresso, way too milky, and just a few pieces of ice. I love that they shake the iced drinks but I didn't end up finishing mine. My husband got a cortado and it was much better than my drink. The daily quiche was fantastic and the breakfast sandwich was good but not spectacular. We sat at the bar and watched the baristas work, their flow was really fun to watch and they're very good at making drinks but someone should rethink how much milk goes into an iced latte. Not sure if it was an accident that morning or what because I've gotten iced lattes from this location (to-go) that weren't as weak.
Drinks are good, nothing extraordinary. The coffee shop itself is in a very nice location, lots of good spots to work or people watch. I've had the matcha and golden milk.
Great staff and good energy..

Was hoping to sit down and enjoy a date but it was Packed, even at 11am on a Friday.

The culture was great, the vibe was def for upper class, young professionals & millennials.     The coffee was good.   The parking was easy.  The customer service was polite
Good coffee, nice service!
The best Coffee shop in CLT!  I highly recommend the Brown Sugar Vanilla Latte!

Undercurrent Coffee has an incredible selection of coffee and treats. I love their iced coffee and espresso. Above all, the environment inside the building is homey and comfortable. This is a great spot to work, hangout with friends, or just relax!
A great experience. Friendly team, great coffee and the good was delicious.
The best cappuccino and avocado toast in Charlotte . I'm in love
Coffee was great and the building is amazing!
Coffee refreshing and smooth. Very good.

We mainly came for the coffee but grabbed breakfast as well. The coffee we ordered lattes (didn't mention that we wanted iced) so we received them hot so we asked for ice and poured the hot coffee over the ice It wasn't the best but that's on us so be sure to communicate! W your barista. The service was slow despite it not being busy, and 2 drinks were remade during our visit which sort of had me worried at that point. The food I had a PB & banana on toast, my gf had the breakfast sandwich and she said the eggs were fluffy but the sandwich was slightly cold. We would have asked for a remake or so but we had an appt to attend.
I love this cafe because they offer mugs for dining in helping with my zero waste / plastic free journey! And also their golden milk latte is AMAZING.

This is a really cute and antiquated coffee & Tea House.
Coffee is amazing tea is good,
would definitely recommend trying it out.

My friend and I had a fantastic experience at this coffee shop which also serves delicious teas as well. Laura was extremely helpful nice and patient, her service would make me come back. Destiny was also pleasant. The shop is nicely decored with nice ambiance, the outside patio is very nice, even the bathroom has aesthetic. I ordered the malabar tea which was delicious. I would recommend this shop
Such a cute little place! They have indoor and outdoor seating, and it wasn't too busy on a Saturday afternoon. Prices were quite fair and the flavor of the mocha latte was great!
Cool place to chill and have conversations.  Great location
trendy coffee spot. their milk tea is 10/10 so so good

Nice place to grab a coffee. Great ambiance and friendly staff. I had an iced latte which came out quick and tasting great. I also ordered a breakfast sandwich...which left much to be desired and the reason I had to dock a star. Although listed as a sandwich, it should be called a slider...it's tiny. Think silver dollar sized. And for $6...and that's without the bacon! May come back for a coffee, bit will avoid the sandwich...perhaps a scone or something next time.

Very nice coffee shop, great space inside. Coffee is pretty good. The outdoor seating is a wonderful place to relax and people-watch on a fun stretch of Commonwealth Ave. Gets pretty busy so be prepared for crowds
Staff is very friendly and The restaurant was clean . First time there and our drinks were made efficient and properly.
Amazing everything. We had the matcha latte and green tea...so gooooooddddd! Highly recommend!

I am in love with this coffee shop. The coffee is really good. The avocado toast, scones and quiche are delicious and fresh. I would not recommend the grits, they are the only thing on the menu that in my opinion isn't that good. Service is great. I also love the vibes, they have WiFi too, it's the perfect place to have coffee and check emails, etc. Super cute and vibrant.
Delicious coffee and great place that felt covid safe!
The cortado was on point!
Decent cold brew. Great latte. Very friendly barista!

Absolutely delightful coffee shop.  Very cool and relaxing atmosphere,  great staff,  and coffee.  Excellent service,  space,  and area.
We loved the expresso set up,  cappuccino was great,  and pour over was .  Definitely grab a bag of beans if you're in need.  Cannot wait to come back here again.
Delicious coffee and great place to read a book. Beats the brakes off of Starbucks for sure.
Cozy and good for studying

great atmosphere. love that the shop is dog friendly. 
got a pour over today that was delightful.
fast friendly masked service
Delicious latte. They used real vanilla and it wasn't too sweet. Pleasant atmosphere and chill people.
This place is great, grit bowl was delicious and lots of great coffees to choose from. Indoor/outdoor seating available. Baristas were friendly. Easy parking.

Coffee is great, the place is cute and the vibe is nice, BUT the amount of people allowed inside is dangerous during a pandemic. Seats should be spaced out more and less people inside. I had my coffee outside and it was good.
Good coffee and a great place to meet a friend or get some work done.

I had a wonderful experience here. The cashier & barista were both friendly and helpful.  And I drink one of the best coffees. I came here for a light roast coffee. The one coffee they had pre-brewed was a darker roast which would have costed a standard (for this style coffee shop) 2.75.
They offered to brew me a cup of lightly roasted coffee. As a "pour over" they charge me 7$$$$$
WTH
7 bucks for a cup of coffee

Everything else about this coffee shop deserves a five star.
Seriously I've had coffee in third wave coffee shops all over the USA. I've never paid that much for a pour over. Start charging $4
Great little spot.

Be prepared to take out a loan for two cups of coffee.
Coffee is overpriced and it's not even that good. Charges $18 for two cups when it's right next door to an addiction treatment center.
Nice clean good workers and food.
Every comfortable atmosphere with a prefect coffee menu for the casual and coffee connoisseurs

Recently moved into the area and we've been making early morning weekend trips to Undercurrent. I find their service to be fast in the morning and love that you can order before arriving via an app for when you're in a rush. They've got some seating outside so we usually take our dog along for the trip.  We love the espresso blend and the baristas are also really sweet.
Favorite coffee in Charlotte, all of their unique drinks are amazing. Love the atmosphere and location as well. Also good for morning meals.
Great Coffee. Excellent Service
Lovvvvvved their Carmel latte and avocado toast my new addiction. It's a cute, comfortable, cozy environment that'll make you want to sit down and enjoy your company or read a book.
The menu is simple but efficient. Better than a Starbucks and their latte art is superb. The Cappuccino is smaller than the Lattes which was strange.
Coffee was decent, the breakfast I ordered, not so much.
Lots of outdoor seating with a breakfast menu and excellent coffee!
One of my very favorite places to sit and meet friends, read, journal, etc. - inside or outside! And one of the only places in CLT I've found that serves a golden milk latte! I love this spot.
Good coffee and scone!
Best coffee in Charlotte
Love this place! Just moved here as needed a coffee place to snag some fuel. Great coffee! Favorite place in town so far
Great coffee, and a nice, safe contactless pickup process. Try ordering with Cloosiv.
Lavender Chai Latte. Try it if they have it! Cute place. Would sit for a while to enjoy all that natural light if we weren't in COVID mode.
Loved the mocha latte and lemon lavender pound cake!
Good service. Clean environment to sit outside or inside. Great selection of caffeinated goodness.
Cutest hidden gem! Great atmosphere and drink selection. If you go you have to try their affogato (espresso+ice cream).

This cool little spot on Commonwealth is worth your time and patronage. The coffee is good, the seating area is cozy, and process are fair. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 is their coffee selection doesn't include a dark roast but the pour over was really good.

Very quick service on a Sunday morning. Unfortunately I wasn't the biggest fan of the vanilla latte, it lacked any vanilla flavor and was quite bitter. The brownie bite could be a hockey puck substitute. The interior decor is very very nice and it had a decent amount of foot traffic.
Most of the time you can't expect to find a place to sit down, and I think $4 tea is overpriced, but the staff is really nice, the space is quaint, and the drinks taste great.
Excellent brewed coffee in a low key setting. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Everything is so professional and very clean.

Meal: I ordered the avocado toast based on many reviews, but unfortunately, the spiced seasoning left an undesirable taste in my mouth. If you have not tried "dukkah" before, I would suggest you get a sample before paying $10.75 for the entree. The presentation was beautiful and the egg on top was cooked perfectly, but the spiced nuts just didn't taste good, imo. I ordered an almond milk latte, but they didn't have almond milk, so I went with the oat milk latte for a little over $5 and it was delicious!

Staff: I received good service on a busy weekday at 1:30PM.

Seating: There's couches and cushioned individual seats at the front, which seats about 9 people. The utensils, napkins, and water are located near the couches. There's one 4-5 seater table located next to the bar seats. A divider book shelf separates the front of the coffee shop, and there's maybe 10 more seats in the back portion near their "lab" and the restrooms. For a busy weekday, there were still open seats in the back portion of the shop where there's plenty of wall outlets for electronics, but I wouldn't recommend this setting for a group meeting since there aren't a lot of tables where you can face each other. They didn't have outdoor porch seating the day I came, but it is an option on other days, but those are still hard to snatch up. I recommend coming around 4PM. That was the least busiest time if you want to grab coffee and work on something real quick.

Parking: It's tough to find parking in this whole area. Their back parking lot has 6 spots and a handicap spot. I circled around and eventually found a spot off the street where you have to back in. For those spots, if you don't back in, it's a $25 fine just FYI.

Internet: Sadly, it wasn't working the day I came. I logged into another establishment's WiFi, but it did slow me down based on productivity due to poor connection. The ambiance and music volume at the establishment was okay. It didn't interfere with me focusing. I stayed 2.5 hours, read, and worked using my phone the rest of the time.

Restrooms: One of the restrooms was missing a handle, so the large hole had brown paper towel stuffed in it for privacy? The other bathroom was tidy. I would just recommend a good floor scrubbing/power wash to get the dirt off from between the tiles.

Though the Internet had network issues and the food was a miss for me, I'd come again to get another drink and try a new entree.
Very nice interior, great coffee
Enjoy working at this coffee shop on off days. The Wi-Fi always works well. Coffee and coffee based drinks are great. The food is a little pricey for what it is but otherwise love it!
This place always makes some great coffee! I always enjoy coming here to relax and sip on a variety of different coffees!
Fantastic place to spend time on your laptop and have a top notch cup of coffee.
Good atmosphere, good food, internet was fast but needed to restart my computer after about an hour to get back on. It seemed during busy hours, it may have been difficult to get a seat.
Ho preso un te con un'amica seduta comodamente a chiacchierare per due ore. Tranquillo.
My fiance liked the (expensive) coffee, trying to park here is a nightmare
Nice, Quaint Ambiance with Delicious Coffee, offering both staples & daily special.
Nice place to have a quick meeting or so.

Solid shop with great coffee, friendly staff and excellent food options.  It's well organized and super clean.  Parking can be challenging but well worth the trouble.  An owner/operator makes it nice as well.

A cozy little house from the outside and bright, modern cozy in the inside. I enjoyed the vibe of this space and they have lovely coffee and healthy, allergy friendly food options. As one frequenting coffee shops for studying, I found that this place had a pretty good set up for individual or group studying. Of course the focus level just depends on did around you.

Visiting family from out of town and needed a quick bite to hold us over so we didn't show up hangry. Super fresh and modern atmosphere! Had the grit bowl and avocado toast with hummus. Served in a tasteful bowl and plate both full of flavor and savory. Coffee was delicious!

Modern but comfortable space in a cool neighborhood. Friendly staff and, dare I say it, probably the best coffee I've had in Charlotte.  Cappuccino was excellent and even my wife's batch brew was dang good. Yeah, 5 stars for sure just from the coffee alone (which is what we should be judging coffee shops on anyway...).
Great place to relax with a cup of coffee and a bite to eat, if you can find a place to sit. Very busy place.
Fantastic cafe! Great coffee, awesome atmosphere

They serve very good coffee . It's a nice welcoming space.lot of seating to get stuff done
Good for groups and alone also
Great coffee and grits. Super yummy
Great place with great coffee selection. However if loud music is your pet peeve watch out, there was 90s rock playing loudly the entire time i was trying to study.
Single origin americano, the flavor development on the beans, exceptional. Digging the roast.

Undercurrent Coffee NAILS everything! From all the obvious things you'd want to the smallest details you didn't even know would add to your coffee shop experience, I was truly impressed. Visiting from Southern California, we're not lacking in coffee shops and as a student I've visited a ton over the last few years, but Undercurrent has distanced itself as my best coffee shop experience to date!

COFFEE / FOOD
Delicious! Not only is their drip fresh and their lattes beautifully crafted, they offer a relatively large menu of options including non-caffeinated drinks and speciality drinks. Their coffee is a smooth, balanced experience and you really can't go wrong with their offerings. You can really appreciate their creativity in some of their drink. As for the food, while it might not blow you away, they have a number of brunch options including a grits bowl that isn't too bad.

SERVICE
Every worker I've come across so far has been pleasant and helpful. I've had no issues and even when there was a power outage for a time, the workers were very accommodating to allow customers to still hangout inside while other nearby business closed down completely.

AMBIENCE / AMENITIES
This is probably where Undercurrent shines the most! Inside, you'll find a spacious, clean, and modern shop accentuated by large windows and tungsten lighting that invite a remarkably warm atmosphere. I love the minimalistic feel of the whole place.

As for amenities, they offer a number of seating options from couches towards the front, a community work table in the middle, and small tables towards the back. Bar seating throughout. At each spot, you'll find conveniently placed outlets. Seating is comfortable and the desks are wooden in texture (I hate glossy/glass tables). Parking can be limited but there are no time limits on the main street!

Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend Undercurrent Coffee! Really wish we had this place in SoCal--it would be my absolute go-to for meetups, studying, or just to relax. Go check them out!
How is this place getting good reviews??  The food is below average, but the service is the worst.  Horribly disappointed I chose to have breakfast here on my trip to Charlotte.  Go anywhere else.
Finally this place get's finished being built.
Great coffee, love the gluten free muffins as well! Make more...

Get the Golden milk
Super good
Great atmosphere, great coffee, great service
It is very lovely place. They have Ethiopian coffee wich is so delicious.
Both the atmosphere and the tea were excellent.  I will definitely visit and recommend again.
Excellent coffee!
Really good food! Coffee was good as well. They have gluten free bread and many gluten free and vegan/vegetarian options.

Loved this coffee shop! They had a good selection of loose leaf teas, I had the rosella which was delicious! The atmosphere was nice and quiet with a lot of people working on their computers or reading and some chatting.
I had their Matcha latte at Optimist Hall (not at this location though) and it was really good. Highly recommend it!

Excellent espresso drinks, made accurately to personal preference.  Plaza Midwood continues it's inexorable encroachment on the shady side of Commonwealth Ave: soon, only carefully curated Japanese maples and BMWs with running bumper stickers will inhabit all the land this side of Independence Blvd muahahahahahahaa
My go to coffee spot in Plaza midwood, always consistently good coffee. Seating is great and comfortable to get work done
Very cozy and modern place to enjoy coffee and teas.
Cozy place n highly recommend their Chai Latte
Do yourself a solid and just go. Currently the best shop in Charlotte.

I love this coffee shop! Lots of great coffee, food, and other drink options. I always order the sea salt mocha latte with oat milk: delicious! Service is quick and friendly. Beautiful interior design and outside seating.

Very relaxed, friendly environment that feels a little like somebody started building a spa and then changed their mind and did a coffee shop instead. Food looks good, but it's a pretty limited selection. The coffee was very good.
Excellent coffee!

baristas are all uber friendly & the large windows make great for natural light. i literally loooove coming here to work & enjoy a nice cup of coffee or matcha. plenty of space for a casual cup or a collab meeting or some private work.

I come here often, multiple times per week for the last year its been open. I cannot say enough about the service, the quality of the drinks and food. But what I find that sets them apart is the vibe of the place. With all walks of life blending together in camaraderie you don't normally see, this is truly a special place.
